website_summaries.verdict: Perfectly designed for multitaskers, stylish, and surprisingly portable, this flexible PC provides many significant refinements over the original Surface Laptop.
pros: Up to 14.5 hours of battery life
cons: Not all configurations are available for all color options

customer_reviews.title: Massive Memory leak Ambient Light Sensor
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but trouble with the Microsoft Surface 2 laptop I received. I've had several blue screens of death. Whenever I came back to it after not using it for a while it was unresponsive and required a reboot. After several days of problems, I found a solution on the Internet, disable the Surface Intersil Ambient Light Sensor, see the attached video for how this works. Also notice how much memory is freed up when this device is disabled. The one star review is because you should not need to search for solutions like this for a new laptop. I would have rather the computer be dead on arrival than partially working.
customer_reviews.author: Victor John Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife who is in nursing school. It’s fast and does everything she needs. It’s light weight so she can carry it around with her books all day. The price was cheaper than Best Buy and was delivered very fast.
customer_reviews.author: jpadget

customer_reviews.title: Reluctant Skeptic  Converts to Windows OS
customer_reviews.text: I use my notebook when I am outside my home or office as I have desktops in both locations. My usage is primarily productivity software/apps. I wanted something lighter than my Macpro for my travels and external meetings. I bought a an iPad Pro 12.9 inches and it simply didn't work for me. I reluctantly bought the Surface Laptop - old fears of Windows OS: viruses, speed. Its weight (or lack thereof), keys, pen/touch screen and seamless use of MS Office won me over. Seven months in, I have no regrets. I actually bought a Windows Desktop to replace my Mac.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Mordi

customer_reviews.title: Light and Fast Computer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the new Microsoft Surface Laptop 2. The 256 GB SSD is very fast. I used it with Microsoft Office and OneDrive. It has excellent battery life so I've been leaving my power cord at home. The internal microphone is very good and I have been using it for recording audio.
customer_reviews.author: K. Behr

customer_reviews.title: Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, fast loading, good backlit keyboard, and a great screen. The only "shortcoming" is the excessively short (24 inches) OEM provided charging cord. Easily remedied by ordering a readily available six-foot cord.
customer_reviews.author: Bob D.

customer_reviews.title: Flawed. But good service.
customer_reviews.text: The screen turned yellow around the edges. But Microsoft is willing to replace the laptop. They stood behind supporting their product.
customer_reviews.author: Internet Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good Laptop, Good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The Laptop works very well. The seller made a mistake with the storage but their customer feedback was on point and it was resolved. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Ya Luo

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop , no issues
customer_reviews.text: Slightly annoyed with the charger and the alcontera getting dirty, but it's a good laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jhonson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, fast and everything i hoped for as a business laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Z.

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy that it came with Win 10 Home installed
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy that this unit came with Windows 10 Home installed. What I need is Pro. I could not find any where in the description that said Home was preinstalled. The physical equipment is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This entire laptop series is designed around forcing you to buy more products. It is incompatable with almost anything that isn't microsoft. If you are willing to put some work in you could probably build a much more powerful laptop for about the same price as you will spend on this and the accessories for it. Its accessories are also garbage and will randomly cut off on you. Battery life lasts a few hours on Battery Saving mode.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Overall a nice nice laptop
customer_reviews.text: The computer is great, very light with a very nice clear display. I was able to stream videos all day before recharging. The keyboard touch sensitivity is also very crisp and designed very well. My two complaints were the facial recognition software was somewhat buggy and required a driver roll back in order to work plus it only has one USB port and I was able to get around that issue by using a Bluetooth mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Don Of Middlebury

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: College student use. Seemed reasonable for the price. Always been happy with MSFT. After less than one year use the mouse pad has broken requiring an after market mouse, the battery is shot, and the charger won't provide a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stern

customer_reviews.title: Amazing computer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect laptop for small business use or personal use. Lightning-fast responsiveness oh, perfect size screen, lightweight. It's more than I could have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kfricke

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic laptop  that is up to most tasks
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made very impressive piece of hardware from a company known for software more than hardware but that may be changing. Great display and long battery life but there are limited apps available although they seem to working hard to address this. This is no card reader abd I would have liked s brand new kaptop to have a USB C port.
customer_reviews.author: tim can

customer_reviews.title: Best option for MODERN, THIN , LIGHT small laptop
customer_reviews.text: This FAR exceeds all other options on the market. I tried everything and settled on this. The entire Surface lineup blows away Apple and the rest....Bravo Microsoft, about time.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Best Laptop I Have Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through so many laptops over the years, and this is the only model I actually recommend to people. Despite small annoyances, this is the #1 laptop on the market that I've ever tried. Pros: minimalist design, reliability, portability, durability, cool factor, performance Cons: charger broke and pulls out of the laptop easily; I wish the keyword/mousepad clicking were quieter, especially at night when others are sleeping
customer_reviews.author: Dekker Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Touchpad broke in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Touchpad popped out in the first six months. Takes$500 to replace. Garbage
